page.title: 12 The Church
page.content: The present church, built about 1375, stands on the site of an earlier one probably founded by the de Corton famil in the 12th.century. The first known rector was Philip le Clerk in the reign of Henry 1.Leiston Abbey obtained the appropriation and advowson in 1367 and thereafter appointed vicars until the Reformation. The present building, although partly ruinous, is large and elegant with a lofty tower which was not completed until 1480. the church contains a 15th. century "East Anglian" font mediaeval poppy head bench ends and a unique gable cross showing Our Lady and the Crucifixion.
